result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian G Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must be compliant with any child support/paternity orders. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Sentencing hearing on November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Adrian G Diaz in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to amended count, the State recommends 3 yrs I/S bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES, consec - 2 yrs conc probation.

finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)1-PCS w/INTENT THC, 2nd & subsequent, repeater It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adrian G Diaz in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Adrian G Diaz in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for bond to be modified to signature bond. Deft is in custody until the end of July on a sanction. Defendant has a COP scheduled 6/22. The State objects to any modification of bond in this case noting the deft has a substantial number of drug convictions on his record and that deft was on supervision when this matter occurred. The State does not object to the deft being granted a furlough to allow him to attend the birth of his child. Defense asks that COP be rescheduled as she is no longer available. 

BTC: bond modification is granted. Bond may be converted to signature bond. Deft to be tested weekly by ZCI and after every court appearance. All other terms and conditions as previously ordered remain.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
